Do not guard log invocations with if blocks using log enforcement variables or isLoggable(). The Log framework does this check for you. Remove the surrounding if block and call to log completely unguarded

The `release()` call is not always reached (can exit the method via path acquire() → d() → removeMessages() → sendMessageDelayed() → obtainMessage() → break → exit; use try/finally to ensure `release` is always called)

The `release()` call is not always reached (because of a possible exception in the path acquire() → try → sleep() → if → ! → then → connect() → loop → if → ! → then → doSend() → exit; use try/finally to ensure `release` is always called)

The `release()` call is not always reached (can exit the method via path acquire() → w() → report() → removeMessages() → sendMessageDelayed() → obtainMessage() → break → exit; use try/finally to ensure `release` is always called)

The `release()` call is not always reached (can exit the method via path acquire() → d() → removeMessages() → sendMessageDelayed() → obtainMessage() → break → exit; use try/finally to ensure `release` is always called)

Provide a timeout when requesting a wakelock with `PowerManager.Wakelock.acquire(long timeout)`. This will ensure the OS will cleanup any wakelocks that last longer than you intend, and will save your user's battery.
